library.description: Grunt is a task-based command line build tool for JavaScript projects
library.name: Grunt

library.description: Yeoman (n) 1. A noble servant, carrying out various duties for the sovereign. Associated with hard toil. 2. Your new favorite web application stack and development tool.
library.name: Yeoman

library.description: Brunch is an assembler for HTML5 applications. It‘s agnostic to frameworks, libraries, programming, stylesheet & templating languages and backend technology.
library.name: Brunch

library.description: JavaScript build tool, similar to Make or Rake. Built to work with Node.js.
library.name: jake

library.description: A modern browser development toolkit. JavaScript, CSS, and template compilers, linting, optimization, serving, RequireJS support, and Live Reload built right in. Pluggable for authoring your own functionality.
library.name: Mimosa

library.description: A continuous integration tool for javascript, css and html. Anvil started as a way to build a single javascript module from several source files. Build tools that require a lot of explicit/declarative instructions distract from getting work on the project done. Anvil has been rewritten as a general build system with a plugin architecture. It should be easy to add features or change almost any behavior as needed.
library.name: Anvil.js

library.description: Task automation tool built in JavaScript. A little detail that makes Automaton a powerful tool, is that every autofile you create can itself be used by another autofile, turning the first one into a single task (imagine boxes within boxes). If you are curious, you can take a look at the source code, and check for yourself that even the tasks that Automaton provides built-in are simple autofiles.
library.name: Automaton

library.description: Minimalistic replacement for Makefiles.
library.name: indev

library.description: A lightweight, unopinionated static-site builder.
library.name: Metalsmith

library.description: James.js is a composable build tool which prefers code over configuration. The usage of streams simplifies its API somewhat in comparison to some other tools.
library.name: james.js

library.description: Scalable web-applications using the Cluster API and Workers.
library.name: nodejs-cluster-express

library.description: Fez is an über fast, highly configurable, extremely powerful, and somewhat weird general purpose build tool written in JavaScript. Build specs are created with a simple JavaScript-based DSL. The set of rules defined in the spec is used to construct a build graph which is efficiently traversable, enabling Fez to do only the work which needs to be done, and to do work in parallel when it can.
library.name: Fez

library.description: Minimalistic Task Manager
library.name: bud

library.description: Mod is a task-based workflow tooling for web, it helps developers quickly build robust and high-performance HTML5 applications.
library.name: modjs

library.description: asm.js is an extraordinarily optimizable, low-level subset of JavaScript
library.name: asm.js

library.description: A fast, reliable asset pipeline, supporting constant-time rebuilds and compact build definitions. Comparable to the Rails asset pipeline in scope, though it runs on Node and is backend-agnostic.
library.name: Broccoli

library.description: The (Java|Coffee)Script and (CSS|Less) (Builder|Bundler|Packer|Minifier|Merger|Checker).
library.name: buildr

library.description: Gear.js is an easy to use, simple to extend, and powerful build system. Chain tasks together to build projects with ease.
library.name: Gear.js

library.description: How would you smoosh a lion and a tiger? A tialiganer, right?
library.name: smoosh

library.description:
Javascript powered shell scripts

Write shell scripts using Javascript. Allows to (synchronously) spawn commands, expand arguments, file globbing, pipes, stream redirects etc. Use all your favorite bash constructions in Javascript!
library.name: nscript

library.description: Stylesheet merger and minifier full of build customization options using HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript.
library.name: Builder.CSS

library.description: Closure FX Builder is a stand-alone and feature-rich application for Google Closure Tools that allows you to minify, obfuscate and debug JavaScript code.
library.name: Closure FX Builder

library.description: plovr is a build tool that dynamically recompiles JavaScript and Closure Template code. It is designed to simplify Closure development, and to make it more enjoyable.
library.name: Plovr

library.description: The streaming build system.
library.name: Gulp

library.description: Provides a JavaScript source file preprocessor, e.g. to build different versions of a library. It's for example used to build ProtoBuf.js (its build and main script are quite good examples).
library.name: Preprocessor.js

library.description:
Metaprogramming is the writing of computer programs that write or manipulate other programs (or themselves) as their data, or that do part of the work at compile time that would otherwise be done at runtime.

MetaScript is a tool for compile time meta programming using JavaScript as the meta language.
library.name: MetaScript
